title: Platinum's shouldn't play vs Silvers in ranked games.
body: I recently played a ranked game vs an enemy team with two platinum's and three golds. While my team has two silvers and three golds.Now I would like to know how in the world that is fair every enemy player was higher ranked than their lane counter parts how am I suppose to win this kind of game please can someone explain to me why this happens it this hopefully their is just a problem with match making and that this is not intentional. Please up vote so more can see this.

replies.body: as usual, another silver player who doesnt understand how the ranked system works. MMR is what determines who plays, not rank.

Just because it can be explained doesn't mean it's how it should work.
It's redundant to have both ranks and MMR. If someone is playing like a plat but is currently in silver, they should be able to easily get out of silver as that is not the elo they belong in, but if their MMR makes it so that they're matched against other plats, while still in silver, then how are they supposed to get out of silver? Why should you be held back from getting where you belong? It just makes the climb unnecessarily grindy.

Not intentional, but it has to do with MMR i do believe. Someone can drop in MMR more than their rank does, and people can climb in MMR faster than their rank climbs.

Or one or two of those golds brought a plat buddy. If i think of it correctly (though i could be wrong, so please dont quote me)....:

Golds can only be paired with silvers and plats on their team. Silvers only bronze and gold. Plats golds and diamonds.

This means that if a gold player brought a platnium friend, then the plat could potentially never get matched with silvers on their team. Thus resulting in all golds and plats because those are the only 2 ranks that fit the rank requirements.
